title: The Binding of Isaac implies that killing innocent children can be justified if you believe God told you to

author: launday
text:
Hi, Muslim here. I believe we have a POV on this as well as this question could just as easily be posed to us despite us believing the sacrificial son was Ismael(as).

1st of all, atheists try to water down all the pertinent details of the matter and end up reducing the issue to, ‚Äúhear a voice, kill your kids‚Äù. If u hear a voice that tells u to slaughter your kids. Don‚Äôt do it please. Especially atheists, considering how your morality shifts like the wind.

Now I think I can answer for both Muslims and Christians when I say, if I was in Ibrahim(as) or Ismael(as) or Ishaaq(as) shoes, I would have liked to remain as stead fast as the Prophets were during this test. Why? Well Ibrahim(as) by this point was an old man. He spent an entire lifetime obeying Allah(swt). He would give up his own safety by trusting in Allah(swt) and everytime Allah(swt) protected him and saved him. This isn‚Äôt just a voice He is hearing. He is very familiar with Allah(swt). He has a relationship with him and He has been carrying out his commandments through out. He trusts Allah(swt) won‚Äôt steer him wrong. This wasn‚Äôt the 1st time he was asked to do something that didn‚Äôt make sense to him accept that He was merely commanded to do it and He followed through.

He was asked to destroy the idols of his city. He did that and as a result he was to be thrown in a fire pit. God commanded him to jump in the pit and the pit turned into a pit of soft flowers and he was saved. He was commanded to go to Egypt where his wife was taken from him. He Followed Allah‚Äôs (swt) commands and as a result he left Egypt with riches and Hagar along with his wife safely. He asked Gid to show him how God gives life and God asked him to cut a dead bird in four pieces and put them in 4 separate corners. He did that and God brought a butchered dead bird back to life. God asked him to leave his 1st born and the mother of his 1st born in a barren desert valley, Bacca/Mecca. For an old man to finally have a son and have to leave him in a barren desert must have been gut wrenching. But he Obeyed. When he was asked to return to the valley. The valley had been transformed into a little city with Hagar(ra) and Ismael(as) safe.

If after all this built up of trust and faith, Allah(swt) asks hin to slaughter his teenage child. Why would Ibrahim(as) disobey. He has literally seen Allah(swt) give and take away life. He has seen the miracles, He has seen the results of obeying Allah(swt) and He has seen Allah(swt) paralyze a king. Why would he believe He or his son will not eventually come out of this test safely?

Atheists need to contextualize the matter and not reduce everything to facile arguments designed to only cause shock and outrage.
